newsitem.title: INDIA: India's TISCO down after net falls.
newsitem.headline: India's TISCO down after net falls.

text.p: Shares of India's largest private steelmaker Tata Iron & Steel Company (TISCO) fell five rupees, or nearly three percent, to 168.50 on the Bombay bourse on Monday, traders said.
They said speculators were hammering the stock after the firm announced a lower net profit for the year ended March 31, 1997.
TISCO said after trading hours on Friday its net profit fell to 4.69 billion rupees in 1996/97 (April-March), from 5.66 billion in the previous year.
Analysts said the company had been expected to perform badly in a slowing economy.
They said TISCO, which has underperformed Bombay's top 30-share index 14 percent this year is expected to continue underperforming the market till the economy shows signs of revival.
